title: New message about InfluxDB analytics always shows

labels.name: outdated
labels.description: PR was locked due to age

body:
### `brew doctor` output

```shell
Your system is ready to brew.
```


### Verification

- [X] My "`brew doctor` output" above says `Your system is ready to brew.` and am still able to reproduce my issue.
- [X] I ran `brew update` twice and am still able to reproduce my issue.
- [X] This issue's title and/or description do not reference a single formula e.g. `brew install wget`. If they do, open an issue at https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/issues/new/choose instead.

### `brew config` output

```shell
HOMEBREW_VERSION: 4.0.28-67-ge9ac36a
ORIGIN: https://github.com/Homebrew/brew
HEAD: e9ac36a5424f97ec48d21aba31128576c16ffab2
Last commit: 2 hours ago
Core tap JSON: 14 Jul 03:08 UTC
HOMEBREW_PREFIX: /opt/homebrew
HOMEBREW_CASK_OPTS: []
HOMEBREW_EDITOR: vim
HOMEBREW_MAKE_JOBS: 8
HOMEBREW_NO_ENV_HINTS: set
Homebrew Ruby: 2.6.10 => /System/Library/Frameworks/Ruby.framework/Versions/2.6/usr/bin/ruby
CPU: octa-core 64-bit arm_firestorm_icestorm
Clang: 14.0.3 build 1403
Git: 2.41.0 => /opt/homebrew/bin/git
Curl: 7.88.1 => /usr/bin/curl
macOS: 13.4.1-arm64
CLT: 14.3.1.0.1.1683849156
Xcode: N/A
Rosetta 2: false
```


### What were you trying to do (and why)?

Run `brew up` on a regular basis.

### What happened (include all command output)?

The below message always shows up
```
==> Homebrew's analytics have entirely moved to our InfluxDB instance in the EU.
We gather less data than before and have destroyed all Google Analytics data:
  https://docs.brew.sh/Analytics
Please reconsider re-enabling analytics to help our volunteer maintainers with:
  brew analytics on
```

### What did you expect to happen?

After seeing this message once and having `influxanalyticsmessage = true` being set in `/opt/homebrew/.git/config` along with `analyticsmessage = true`. It doesn't show up again. I realize I have `analyticsdisabled = true` on but I shouldn't be spammed every time I run `brew up` and have updated formulas.

### Step-by-step reproduction instructions (by running `brew` commands)

`brew up` and you have updated formulas so `update-report` runs. You can also run `brew update-report` manually to see that the message is always displayed if you have analytics disabled even after `influxanalyticsmessage = true` is set in your git config.
